body_html:
An enum might describe the list if operations, but we'd still need to describe all the inputs, their types, any attributes, default values - essentially all the contents of the OpDef protocol buffer that is created with the REGISTER_OP macro calls, so merely listing out the operations without describing how to use them seems insufficient, no?

I might be misunderstanding, but it sounds like you're searching for an enum to encapsulate what grep REGISTER_OP in the codebase will do right now?
body_text:
An enum might describe the list if operations, but we'd still need to describe all the inputs, their types, any attributes, default values - essentially all the contents of the OpDef protocol buffer that is created with the REGISTER_OP macro calls, so merely listing out the operations without describing how to use them seems insufficient, no?
I might be misunderstanding, but it sounds like you're searching for an enum to encapsulate what grep REGISTER_OP in the codebase will do right now?
body:
An enum might describe the list if operations, but we'd still need to describe all the inputs, their types, any attributes, default values - essentially all the contents of the [`OpDef` protocol buffer](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/framework/op_def.proto) that is created with the `REGISTER_OP` macro calls, so merely listing out the operations without describing how to use them seems insufficient, no?

I might be misunderstanding, but it sounds like you're searching for an enum to encapsulate what `grep REGISTER_OP` in the codebase will do right now?
